problem: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 < n < 90,$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan 252^\circ.$
gptanswer:
We know that $\tan (252^\circ) = \tan (252^\circ - 360^\circ) = \tan (-108^\circ),$ since the tangent function has period $180^\circ.$

Now, we want to find an integer $n$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan (-108^\circ).$ Since the tangent function has period $180^\circ,$ we can add or subtract multiples of $180^\circ$ to $-108^\circ$ to get other angles with the same tangent. Specifically, we have:

\begin{align*}
\tan (-108^\circ) &= \tan (-108^\circ + 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan 72^\circ \\
&= \tan (72^\circ - 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan (-108^\circ - 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan (-288^\circ).
\end{align*}

Therefore, $n = \boxed{-288}.$
